title: ESA discovers butterfly-shaped crater on Mars showing impact, volcanism and water
description: Mars Express has found a unique butterfly-shaped crater on Mars. This formation resulted from a space rock hitting at a low angle. The impact ejected debris in two lobes, creating wing-like structures. Scientists believe subsurface ice or water may have been involved. The area also shows signs of ancient volcanic activity.

title: Why RBI cut repo rate even with low inflation, high growth? Sanjay Malhotra explains
description: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, citing benign inflation and a resilient economy. Despite a strong GDP growth forecast of 7.3% for the fiscal year, the central bank sees potential softening ahead. This move aims to support growth momentum while maintaining macroeconomic stability.

title: CCTV captures assault: Jeweller stabbed to death during robbery; accused watched 25 ‘tutorials'
description: A shocking daylight robbery turned fatal in Modinagar. A 75-year-old jeweller was brutally stabbed to death by an assailant who threw chilli powder in his face. The attacker was quickly caught by alert locals after a brief chase. The incident highlights concerns over law and order in the area. Police are investigating the motive and have detained the suspect.

description: Travelers throughout India experienced a wave of flight cancellations and lengthy delays, with IndiGo being the hardest hit. Families found themselves marooned at airports, grappling with steep rebooking fees and unclear travel arrangements. This turmoil, caused by new regulations on crew rest periods, left many bewildered and desperate for clarity amidst the operational chaos.

description: India and Russia are deepening their defense ties, focusing on niche technologies and industrial cooperation. Despite global pressures, New Delhi reaffirms its strategic autonomy. Discussions included S-400 systems, Sukhoi upgrades, and BrahMos missile advancements, underscoring a commitment to bolstering India's indigenous defense capabilities and maintaining a strong partnership with Moscow.

title: Russian President’s visit turns parts of city into a fortress
description: President Putin's visit to New Delhi has transformed key areas into a heavily fortified zone, mirroring G20 security measures. His custom-built Aurus Senat limousine, a "rolling bunker," was flown in for his protection. A five-layer security grid, combining Russian and Indian elite forces, ensures his safety, with snipers and anti-drone systems deployed.

Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
description: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
description: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Bezos' ex-wife makes bold move: Amazon stake sale funds Howard University gift
description: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Halo deal drama: When Bill Gates told its maker Steve Jobs can’t have it; We will buy you
description: Microsoft's 2000 acquisition of Bungie Studios, spurred by a 1999 Macworld reveal of Halo with Steve Jobs, transformed the game into Xbox's flagship.  This strategic move secured a vital launch title for the console, rescuing Bungie from financial woes and ultimately birthing a multi-billion dollar franchise that redefined console gaming.
